title: Dr. Seuss' The Cat in the Hat
review: Its a fairly dull game with all of its pieces done well enough there just wasnt much put into this. And as a game on its own it doesnt hold up too well.

title: Ducati World Racing Challenge
review: Too many technical problems and not enough fun drive this bike straight into the ground. Youll have more fun playing Hang On again with Shenmue.

title: Ace Banana
review: Ace Banana in its present state is barely playable with Move controllers.

title: DRIV3R
genres: Driving | Action Adventure | Racing | Mission-based | Arcade | Mission-based | Open-World | Automobile
review: Just about as broken as it was on the Xbox and PlayStation 2 last year and thanks to the ill-conceived introduction of a mouse and keyboard into the mix it manages to be even worse overall.

title: Screwjumper!
review: Screwjumper! just should not have been green lit by Microsoft. There’s nothing redeeming about Screwjumper! no reason for anyone to give it a second look and absolutely no way you should spend ten bucks for the download.

title: Made Man: Confessions of the Family Blood
review: The problems with the lack of inspiration or effort. [Christmas 2006 p.81]

title: Chronus Arc
review: At first I was enraged when I started to get killed all the time. Then I figured out how to just grind and the game became easy again until the final boss demanded further statistic embellishment to take down. Now that I have experienced the entirety of a Kemco title I too understand why this constantly-reviled publisher gets so much flak. Maybe other games under the Kemco banner are better: it wouldnt be hard.

title: Adventure Time: Explore the Dungeon Because I DON'T KNOW!
review: It isnt terrible its just dull. [Feb 2014 p.84]

title: Emergency Mayhem
genres: Driving | Racing | Mission-based | Arcade | Mission-based | Automobile
review: The game is extremely easy to finish in a single afternoon. Not that you should play it mind you. There are far better choices out there than Emergency Mayhem.

title: Protothea
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | Scrolling | Scrolling | Shoot-'Em-Up | Vertical
review: Protötheas music is the worst offender though -- its muffled tunelessness recalls the early days of hack composers attempting to extract vaguely music-like noise from the Super NESs default sound libraries. Expect lots of muddy bass and cheesy synth guitars.

title: Psychotoxic
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | First-Person | Fantasy | Fantasy | Arcade
review: For every second of satisfaction there is a minute of monotony; where cardboard enemies fall under a cloud of red paint physics offer no value whatsoever AI is largely non-existent and gameplay follows the worn-ragged formula of coloured keycards and enemies that appear from thin air. [PC Zone]

title: ShellShock 2: Blood Trails
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | First-Person | Third-Person | Historic | Historic | Historic | Arcade
review: You can enjoy the straightforward gameplay in some moments you can be surprised by the horror atmosphere. But those are only small details in the overall game of boredom disturbing mini-games and a bunch of bugs. [Mar 2009]

title: Underground Pool
genres: Sports | Miscellaneous | Parlor | Individual | Billiards | Billiards
review: If you’re a pool enthusiast who finds they can’t get a table at the pub then Actua Pool will fix your cravings just don’t go expecting anything special.

title: Freedom: First Resistance
review: We saw plenty of good action/adventures in the year 2000. This wasnt one of them. [Mar 2001 p.82]

title: Eureka Seven Vol. 2: The New Vision
review: Despite the differing game play at least one element remains shared between the various situations and scenarios of Eureka Seven Vol. 2: boredom. With no real skill required to complete the simple challenges most gamers will breeze through the dull segments given enough time and button mashing leaving them to question the point in repeating those same bits of play over and over again.

title: Adventure Time: Explore the Dungeon Because I DON'T KNOW!
review: Unlike the show it’s based on it’s both deeply boring and devoid of imagination. For a real sense of adventure play Spelunky.

title: Xiaolin Showdown
review: Xiaolin Showdown is a bad game plain and simple. In a genre where speed and chaos is an important part of gameplay Xiaolin Showdowns fights are out and outright tedious.

title: Painkiller: Hell & Damnation
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | First-Person | Fantasy | Fantasy | Arcade
review: No amount of ragdoll-fumbling can save this Gothic horror show. [Sept 2013 p.94]

title: Farming Simulator
review: Theres farming but little of the promised simulation. [Dec 2013 p.73]

title: Escape Dead Island
genres: Action Adventure | Adventure | 3D | Survival | Third-Person | Modern
review: Escape Dead Island is a terrible game with substandard graphics unimaginative and rigid gameplay convoluted story and unforgivable optimization issues.

title: Inner Chains
review: With its fantastic art direction Inner Chains could have been a great walker. Unfortunately what the developers decided to make is a lame uninspired awfully boring first-person shooter that has absolutely nothing to offer in terms of gameplay. [08/2017 p.72]

title: The Warriors: Street Brawl
review: So if you can get past its many flaws—or you just enjoy repeatedly having your ass handed to you—there’s quite a bit to do here for 800 Microsoft Points (about $10).

title: Brain Boost: Gamma Wave
review: For the price youll pay for both these games -- which is what youll need to do if you want a half-decent selection of activities -- you could buy the far superior Brain Age. Or for that matter you could buy just about any of the other genuinely good games on the DS and pass over this cash-in altogether.

title: MTV Sports: Skateboarding featuring Andy Macdonald
review: A slovenly title that drowns in its own inferiority.

title: Zatch Bell! Mamodo Fury
review: There’s no reason any self-respecting gamer would pick up Zatch Bell! Mamodo Fury. The game is broken at times painful during others and sports and overall felling of frustration for anyone brave enough to endure it.

title: Blood Drive
genres: Simulation | Driving | Racing | General | General | Vehicle | Combat
review: Blood Drive is like a radioactive element - admired from a distance but never to be touched.

title: Prison Break: The Conspiracy
review: Not even the most dedicated fan of the TV show could find this piece of garbage entertaining. Lock this let-down up and throw away the key.

title: Freestyle Street Soccer
review: The gang vernacular and the gratuitous use of swearing may make this game appear cool but you may as well listen to an Andrew Dice Clay recording and play with a string-less yo-yo.

title: Dragon Ball Z: Taiketsu
review: Taiketsu just doesnt work. With bad gameplay graphics sound and multiplayer it leaves this reviewer complaining more than Andy Rooney.

title: Family Guy: Back to the Multiverse
genres: Action | General | Action Adventure | Fantasy | General | Fantasy
review: Family Guy: Back to the Multiverse doesnt make the best use of its licence. The humour isnt as funny in this format and the experience is padded by repetitive fetch quests. Fans of the show may derive some enjoyment out of the in-jokes and multiplayer but everyone else should avoid at all costs.

title: The Golden Compass
review: The Golden Compass the book has received more critical praise than it can count. Unfortunately the same doesnt hold true for the movie or the video game.

title: Scourge: Outbreak
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | Third-Person | Sci-Fi | Sci-Fi | Arcade
review: Predictably you’ll have a much better time blasting away in by-the-numbers deathmatch team deathmatch and capture-the-flag engagements — well if you can find any other players in the ghost town that passes for Scourge’s multiplayer lobby. Given the game’s crippling problems it’s hard to blame folks for staying away in droves.

title: MotionSports
review: Maybe Motionsports original idea to make use of Kinect possibilites to offer a varied set of sport challenge. was a good one but ultimately it has been poorly developed and executed and control doesnt work well enough.

title: Looney Tunes: Acme Arsenal
genres: Action | Action Adventure | Fantasy | Platformer | Fantasy | 3D
review: The biggest problem with Acme Arsenal is that it doesn’t contain an inkling of the depth on display in the classic cartoons its levels attempt to emulate.

title: Real Steel
review: Real Steel is not a noteworthy videogame. It is a shame because the idea could have been great if it had been well executed. It has a very limited and repetitive gameplay and a lackluster appearence.

title: Soldier Elite
review: If theres one thing that blows chunks more than a bad console-to-PC port its a recycled low-budget PC game thats past its due. [Oct. 2006 p.58]

title: Deep Black: Reloaded
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | Third-Person | Modern | Arcade
review: Underwater third-person shooter is good for one and only one purpose: if you want to see every possible game mistake bug and bad design decision packed into one you just got it. [Apr 2012]

title: Battle: Los Angeles
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | First-Person | Sci-Fi | Sci-Fi | Arcade
review: Easy short linear and with embarrasing flaws in AI this game is a huge disappointment.

title: Montague's Mount
review: Montagues Mount is a bad graphic adventure plagued by the backtracking and some of the worst bugs seen in recent years.

title: Charlie and the Chocolate Factory
review: The console releases are better than the truly execrable PC game of the same name but theres still no reason for it to exist.

title: SuperPower
review: With the bugs fixed and the gameplay tweaked and polished Superpower could be pretty decent. At the moment its disappointing.

title: The Cursed Crusade
review: Its too bad because Cursed Crusade has fleetingly interesting ideas like forcing you to push a very slow-moving mantlet towards an enemys defensive line or the way the timing of tapping out combo strings actually encourages thoughtful player response. Co-op can actually be fun in short bursts with a friend and even the detailed aesthetic is surprisingly competent.

title: Ultimate Beach Soccer
review: Gameplay is where UBS really screws up.

title: Torino 2006 - the Official Video Game of the XX Olympic Winter Games
review: It’s something you’ll play for a little while but you’ll soon realize that watching the real thing is far more exciting. It sounds better. It feels faster. And you’ll get to see the podium and hear the anthem of the victor’s nation.

title: Fantastic Four: Rise of the Silver Surfer
review: Tiresome nonsense. [Sept 2007 p.40]

title: Drive Girls
review: Drive Girls is a disappointing game in almost every aspect with only a few redeeming factors.

title: Air Raid: This Is Not a Drill!
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | First-Person | Historic | Historic
review: You have to be jonesing for a decidedly old school arcade experience to appreciate Air Raid and even then its fun for maybe 20-30 minutes at a time if not in total. [Nov 2003 p.101]

title: Army Men: Green Rogue
review: Hmmm...step on a landmine play Green Rogue. Landmine Green Rogue...Ah! Landmine it is!

title: Turning Point: Fall of Liberty
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | First-Person | Historic | Historic | Arcade
review: A perfect storm of cynical derivative design and slipshod implementation. [June 2008 p.102]

title: 25 to Life
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | Third-Person | Modern | Modern | Arcade
review: The bottom line is that it doesnt come even close to the open-ended gameplay of GTA and the overall quality of Max Payne. Drawing any further comparison with these two well-known titles would be a waste of time. In fact the entire game is a waste of time and money.

title: Pocket Racers
review: Incredibly easy to use driving flop.

title: Doctor Who: The Eternity Clock
review: Unforgivable bugs. [Issue#220 p.81]

title: Wacky Races: Crash & Dash
genres: Driving | Racing | Arcade | Kart | Other | Kart
review: Experimental racing concepts should be tested in the developers studios not on shop shelves. [Sept 2008 p.54]

title: Troll and I
review: A longer development period might have made this into something more playable but it would still be a game of rehashed concepts notable only for its sheer banality. [May 2017 p.96]

title: Senran Kagura Reflexions
review: Its hard to recommend Senran Kagura Reflexions to anyone at all. Rather than a game this is more like a collection of screens that test the accuracy of the Joy-Con movements and at that it does work. Unfortunately it fails at everything else and it simple does not provide the content the sense of purpose and the structure necessary to call this a fun interactive experience.

title: RollerCoaster Tycoon 3D
genres: Strategy | Tycoon | Management | Tycoon | Business / Tycoon
review: Manage a theme park and build grand roller coasters. A poorly designed user interface old-fashioned graphics and the lack of certain mechanics makes sure that this game never lives up to its PC predecessors.

title: Brain Boost: Beta Wave
review: For the price youll pay for both these games -- which is what youll need to do if you want a half-decent selection of activities -- you could buy the far superior Brain Age. Or for that matter you could buy just about any of the other genuinely good games on the DS and pass over this cash-in altogether.

title: The Polar Express
review: An ugly collection of poorly conceived minigames The Polar Express is a failure by the standards of any medium.

title: Family Guy: Back to the Multiverse
genres: Action | General | Action Adventure | Fantasy | General | Fantasy
review: The game isnt funny and thats inexcusable.

title: Charlie and the Chocolate Factory
review: The musical score of the game will get on most peoples nerves within the first 20 minutes.

title: 25 to Life
review: 25 to Life does include a somewhat entertaining multiplayer aspect but not enough to keep your attention for very long.

title: Hello Neighbor
review: You might be able to derive some enjoyment from this game but it requires overlooking absolutely essential elements gone awry making Hello Neighbor very difficult to recommend. If you don’t mind solving abstract puzzles and throwing everything (including the kitchen sink) at your objectives all while constantly avoiding a particularly annoying antagonist then you might give this game a try.

title: Coffeetime Crosswords
genres: Miscellaneous | Puzzle | Puzzle | General | Puzzle | Logic | General
review: The controls are awkward there’s no Xbox 360 Chatpad support and the puzzles are mediocre at best (and repetitive at worst).

title: Ju-on: The Grudge
review: Theres nothing worthy on the latest feelPlus work or at least nothing truly enjoyable. Were supposed to be very frightened by the scares that The Grudge repeatedly shows on the screen but the only scary thing here are the gameplay mechanics and the incredible stupidity of our main enemies.

title: Thor: God of Thunder
review: Thor: God of Thunder is a game to avoid.

title: R.I.P.D. The Game
genres: Action | General | General | Shooter | Third-Person | Sci-Fi | Arcade
review: I have reviewed some bad games but this is even bad even for movie tie-in games. This is bad on the level of Aquaman bad.

title: Raven Squad: Operation Hidden Dagger
review: Raven Squad is bland boring and definitely not fun. Avoid it at all cost.

title: Monsters Inc. Scream Arena
review: Scream Arena takes a line from the movie and creates and entire game from it. It’s so thin that the single line in the movie is more entertaining.

title: Anacapri: The Dream
review: So this is a pretty ordinary game that has potential in some areas.

title: Onechanbara: Bikini Samurai Squad
review: For me Onechanbara represents one of the biggest disappointments Ive felt in a game—it looks silly action packed and a little fun. Instead its just repetitive drivel with a bit of cheesecake.

title: Tony Hawk's Motion
genres: Sports | Alternative | Individual | Skateboarding | Skateboarding | Skate / Skateboard
review: Saddled with poor visuals ineffective controls and a complete lack of engaging content Tony Hawks Motion is a crushing disappointment .

title: The Mummy: Tomb of the Dragon Emperor
review: Instead of giving you the game disc the sales assistant could open the box and curl out a steaming log in there and youd have almost as much fun playing with it. [Dec 2008 p.56]

title: Cartoon Network Racing
review: A bad kart racer in every sense of the word. The track design is poor the game feels slow and worst of all the controls are terrible.

title: The Deer God
review: I stared deep into the eyes of the deer waiting for it to speak. There was no grass no trees; just a white void surrounding me and her heavenly grace as she judged me and my actions. But she did not speak. She did not even blink. As the silence dragged on I grew more desperate bargaining with her to just make sense of this please! What should I be feeling? What should I be believing!? Deer God what lesson do I need to learn? She screamed for she did not know. I screamed for I did not know. Perhaps that was the lesson to learn that there is nothing to know. Don’t buy this game.

title: Coffee Tycoon
review: You do nothing else while playing but hit the start and end button occasionally buy things for your store and manage employees.

title: Universal Studios Theme Parks Adventure
review: To think this dire piece of programming is worth 40p let along £40 is an insult to everything we believe in as dedicated gamers. Buy it...go on we dare you. You’ll be the only fool that does...

title: Resident Evil: Survivor
review: This lame first-person shooter with no visual or visceral delights is an insult to the brand name that is Resident Evil.

title: Realms of Ancient War
review: In every review the main question is why would the consumer buy this? For R.A.W. Realms of Ancient War that is a question hard to answer. Yes it is an action RPG like great titles such as Diablo III and Torchlight II. But no we wouldnt recommend this game to anyone.

title: Inkheart
review: If you love the movie you might want to try this out just to see what it’s all about. If you are hankering for a decent adventure game with a book twist go grab Hotel Dusk: Room 215. It’s a much better read.

title: Tony Hawk's Pro Skater 5
review: Despite some noble efforts to take Tony Hawks back to its roots Pro Skater 5 is ruined by glitches sluggish movement and dull lifeless levels. What might have been a glorious return ends up an unfortunate swan song. [Issue#130 p.78]

title: Turn It Around
review: Quirky minigames can be excellent fun but the best collections offer variety. Spinning a wheel ad infinitum just doesnt cut it.

title: Pacific Rim
review: Pacific Rim is a very bad fighting game with a popular license.

title: Alone in the Dark
review: Nearly every gamplay mechanic fails in one way or another. While the game is functional Alone in the Dark is a clear case of something that needed to be baked in the oven longer. The overall concept is solid but the testing phase seems to have been glossed over.

title: Star Wars: Flight of the Falcon
review: The game is hampered by very bad laggy gameplay that seems like in some of the game levels (mostly all of them) it is running at 5 fps.

title: Putty Squad
review: It seems very unfair to suddenly thrust such a dated game back into the limelight but it ready would’ve been better if Putty Squad had stayed in retirement.

title: Motocross Mania 3
review: Poor controls buggy gameplay and a lack of variety make this game a tour de garbage.

title: Burnout Legends
review: Saying that the DS version of Burnout Legends is bad is quite generous. Abomination is a much more fitting word.

title: Dead or Alive Paradise
review: While Dead or Alive: Paradise may appear exciting to a sex-starved 16-year-old the game is insulting to all other audiences; a huge backwards step in an industry desperately trying to mature. Remember this kids: ultimately youre getting yourself worked up over polygon meshes skin coloured textures and clever algorithms. Unless youre really struggling for ways to entertain your libido the game should be categorically avoided.

title: Battleship
genres: Action | Miscellaneous | Board Games | Shooter | Board Games | First-Person | Tactical
review: Bland presentation and sloppy mechanics sink Battleship more effectively than a torpedo ever could.

title: Battle: Los Angeles
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | First-Person | Sci-Fi | Sci-Fi | Arcade
review: Good grief--I could buy Half-Life 2 with that $10. [Aug 2011 p.76]

title: Attack of the Movies 3D
review: Better yet let’s just leave the on-rails style in the ’90s where it belongs. It’s been a nice ride but we need to start moving on.

title: Painkiller: Resurrection
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | First-Person | Fantasy | Arcade
review: You need an extra dose of Painkillers to play Resurrection without headache.

title: Umbrella Corps
review: Umbrella Corp is a game that should have been scrapped not released. It may have started with the best intentions but the end result is a game that relies on tired gameplay and a familiar name. Going back to the drawing board would have been better than what was released now.

title: G.I. Combat
review: G.I. Combats biggest shortcoming is that it has very little gameplay. Instead it has a heap of confusion.

title: Driven
review: You can accelerate up to 200mph within seconds and survive a brutal wall impact but a low-speed scuff on the turf sends your car spinning.

title: Pimp My Ride
review: If mind-numbingly easy repetition is what you enjoy in a game knock yourself out.

title: Godzilla Unleashed
review: Godzilla Unleashed lacks the vibrant larger-than-life destructive mayhem of other Godzilla titles and there really arent enough redeeming qualities otherwise to warrant a purchase…or even a rental.

title: DARK
genres: Action Adventure | Modern | General | Modern | Linear
review: Darks concept is totally out of line and its technical issues are not helping it. Sometimes a good theme occurs but its bad gaming mechanics tread in the game quickly. Its bad as a stealth-action game. Its even worse as a vampire title.

title: The Walking Dead: Survival Instinct
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | First-Person | Sci-Fi | Sci-Fi | Arcade
review: None of its elements is done well enough. The combat system is primitive and slapdash there’s practically just one enemy type with several skins and the level design based on simple greyish blocks is trivial. [CD-Action 06/2013 p.68]

title: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: Out of the Shadows
review: What we are left with is a dull broken button-masher of a campaign a risible barely playable multiplayer game and a couch co-op which puts most players on a level playing field with Mr. Magoo.

title: Naruto Shippuden: Dragon Blade Chronicles
review: Shallow combat frustrating exploration and crippling technical issues make Dragon Blade Chronicles a Naruto adventure to avoid.

title: Vampire Rain
review: In truth the biggest mystery here isnt how vampires evolved and rose to power but how any publisher could justify a $60 price tag for a tiresome exercise in imitation and slipshod execution.

title: Thor: God of Thunder
review: If I havent made my point excruciatingly clear by now let me be very blunt -- do not play this game. Its plodding and dull and isnt even fun in an unintentional way. Just stay away.

title: Project Root
review: Project Root presents a very good base idea but with a poor implementation; we liked the idea of a top-down 360 degrees non-linear shooter but its generic art design many glitches and bad game design decisions keep it from even touching its full potential.

title: Carnival Games: Mini-Golf
genres: Sports | Traditional | Individual | Golf | Arcade | Arcade
review: It’s impossible to give that feeling when players have so little control over their own performance. If you’re looking for a golf game to play on Wii there are plenty to choose from. This one’s definitely not worth the price of admission.

title: Raven Squad: Operation Hidden Dagger
review: Just another ruined idea to throw on the ever-increasing pile. Not even the fact that one of the lines includes the term Satans little piss-pot could save this.

title: Seven Kingdoms: Conquest
review: Believe me Seven Kingdoms Conquest is a wreck you want to avoid.

title: Kengo: Legend of the 9
review: Kengos environment-based attacks nine storylines and Combat Mode simply arent enough to recommend what amounts to a boring and repetitive gameplay experience.

title: The Simpsons Skateboarding
review: It’s sluggish and unresponsive and absolutely riddled with annoying bugs that should have been detected early in the production process.

title: Blades of Time
review: It was a mediocre game when it first came out seven years ago and if anything the benefit of time has made the mediocre assessment seem generous.

title: Rock Revolution
review: Rock Revolution is inferior to its competition in every single possible way. If you absolutely have to try it we urge you to think of it as a track pack of guitar-only songs for Rock Band or Guitar Hero and buy just the game (instead of the drums-included bundle).

title: Legend of the Dragon
review: You’ll need the patience of Buddist monk to progress through the archaic Quest mode without consistently resorting to a cheap Ring Out.

title: Heavy Fire: Red Shadow
review: Honestly the nicest thing I can say about Heavy Fire: Red Shadow is that it’s over in two hours. It is at least technically playable with some interesting mechanics. But even if you are specifically looking for a wave-based arcade-style turret game I’d still stay away. This game offers little of value and is fun only if I stretch that word beyond its absolute limit.

title: Terminator 3: Rise of the Machines
review: Feels like a rushed hack-job of a game with just barely enough cohesive action to keep it from completely falling apart at the seams.

title: SoulCalibur: Lost Swords
review: In some weird way all of Lost Swords bad ideas remind you why you once loved the series.

title: Dying: Reborn
review: Not buying this would be the ultimate lucky escape. [May 2017 p.92]

title: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 1
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | Third-Person | Fantasy | Fantasy | Arcade
review: Maybe EA Games could rename Part 2 Harry Potter and the Multiple Revenue Streams. Because if we are going to be honest thats all this title really is.

title: Hello Neighbor
review: Frustrating buggy and overly dependent on trial-and-error this is a missed opportunity.

title: Looney Tunes: Acme Arsenal
review: Unfortunately Acme Arsenal never really delivers. The gameplay is repetitive and bland never really offering a great deal of enjoyment. One of Bug’s quips as he topples enemies in the game is now this is fun. We’re sorry Bug’s but you’re sorely mistaken.

title: ECW Anarchy Rulz
review: Acclaim needs a new engine and they need it to be radiclly different.

title: Left Behind: Eternal Forces
review: Smug poorly made and incredibly frustrating to play they managed the fearfully but not the wonderfully made. [Apr 2007 p.86]

title: The Mummy: Tomb of the Dragon Emperor
review: Its an infuriatingly unbalanced unpolished and underwhelming experience that nobody -- not even fans of the movies -- should spend money on.

title: Evolution Snowboarding
review: This game is underthought quarterbaked and hopeless. Its one of the worst games on the PS2. [Feb 2003 p.66]

title: Star Wars Episode II: Attack of the Clones
review: Its one of the worst games Ive ever played. [July 2002 p.128]

title: The Ripping Friends
review: Hit-and-miss action. [May 2002 p.140]

title: Steel Battalion: Heavy Armor
genres: Simulation | Sci-Fi | Vehicle | Mech | Mech | Combat
review: Steel Battalion: Heavy Armor is a great game when Kinect decides to obey to your actions but when there are simply too many switches levers and buttons in the game for Kinect to decipher what you are actually wanting to do it just makes the experience extremely aggravating.

title: Godzilla
review: While it does have a lot of fan service it really doesn’t have much else besides clunky gameplay horrible visuals and repetitive gameplay.

title: Bubble Bobble Revolution
review: Normally a title like this would garner a much higher score; due to the inherent bugs however it feels like the game is half-finished. Since it seems only halfway complete the score will also be roughly half of what it would be in normal circumstances.

title: Pure Futbol
genres: Sports | Traditional | Team | Soccer | Sim | Arcade | Arcade
review: Soccer is a simple sport that relies on execution and precise play. Pure Futbol is executed poorly and is an imprecise mess.

title: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 1
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | Third-Person | Fantasy | Fantasy | Arcade
review: Its not shocking that a movie game is terrible but it is somewhat surprising since Harry Potters last two games have been fairly good. The uninspired levels horrendous shooting mechanics lackluster controls and a tacked-on Kinect mode make this one Harry Potter piece of merchandise fans should stay far far away from.

title: Far Cry Vengeance
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | First-Person | Modern | Modern | Arcade
review: A bad conversion of an almost year-old Xbox game. Vengeance is playable but its a massively disappointing Wii debut for the Far Cry series and the worst FPS on the console so far. [Mar 2007 p.84]

title: Touhou Kobuto V: Burst Battle
review: Touhou Kobuto V: Burst Battle originally started out as a PlayStation Vita game and would have released there a few months ago but for NIS Americas desire to do a simultaneous multiplatform release. A game of this quality wouldnt have been acceptable on the Vita and being on the Switch is only serving to expose its myriad flaws to more people. If you need to see girls beat the snot out of each other on the Switch theres already plenty of better options.

title: Randall
review: The metroidvania-lover in me wished Randall turned out to be more enjoyable. There are some interesting ideas here like the use of mind control but the good of that is buried under a litany of technical problems and just general sloppy design. Like the titular hero I found myself frequently battling headaches during my time with the game.

title: Tenchu: Dark Secret
review: Fans of the series will find absolutely nothing to like here and it’s likely that any gamer making Dark Secret their first Tenchu game will never buy another one.

title: Napoleon Dynamite: The Game
genres: Action | Miscellaneous | Puzzle | General | General | Puzzle | Party / Minigame | General
review: This shovelware deserves no space in your home.

title: Torino 2006 - The Official Video Game of the XX Olympic Winter Games
genres: Sports | Olympic Sports | Olympic Sports | Individual | Athletics
review: Its not as if the Olympics be it summer or winter has had anything special to call its own when it comes to video game adaptations over the years but Torino 2006 is especially egregious in that it pares down the number of included events to a fairly measly number manages to make every single one of them completely uninteresting and skimps entirely on the presentation.

title: Pocket Pool
genres: Sports | Miscellaneous | Parlor | Individual | Billiards | Billiards
review: Pocket Pool is just another miserable attempt at using sex to sell a terrible game. While there aren’t many billiard options for the PSP pool fans should look elsewhere and avoid the embarrassment of their girlfriend catching them playing with it.

title: Speed Zone
review: There are parts to like about Speed Zone and it wins some merit badges for the split-screen option. What doesnt go over well is perhaps one of the most crucial parts to a racing game the ability to control your vehicle.

title: TMNT
review: The PSP version has so many things against it: the gameplay is terrible the story is non-existent and the entire game experience ranges from boring to enraging depending on how long youve been playing. I feel almost guilty giving ANY game this bad of a review. But trust me this one earned it.

title: Aqua Teen Hunger Force Zombie Ninja Pro-Am
review: If you love the antics of Aqua Teen Hunger Force consider yourself warned -- Zombie Ninja Pro-Am is a bland affair. You get a subpar (no pun intended) golf game a lame cart-racing game and heaping amounts of monotonous combat.

title: Shifters
review: Cmon were talking about a hack-and-slasher with stationary pinatas for targets here! [August 2002 p.126]

title: Legend of the Dragon
review: There’s very little to like about the Nintendo Wii version of Legend of the Dragon and the fact that very little effort was placed in making the Wii technology fit the game is reason enough to skip this one.

title: Quantum Theory
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | Third-Person | Fantasy | Fantasy | Arcade
review: A truly rubbish shooter that lies deep in Gears shadow pillaging it for set pieces designs and mechanics with zero subtlety. [Issue#64 p.89]

title: Duke Nukem: Land of the Babes
review: Like I say then leave this sucker alone.

title: Fight Club
review: Poor combat mechanics coupled with simplistic controls is where Fight Club begins to fall apart. A weak storyline that feels more like bits and pieces from a larger story told through still images rather than animated scenes takes so much more away from the game then they add making the process of playing through Fight Club more of an exercise in futility than entertaining.

title: Agony
review: Frustrating stealth sections uninspired puzzling and dull action make Agony gaming hell. [Aug 2018 p.73]

title: Crash Boom Bang!
review: A dull and poorly designed game. The mini-games are boring you cant save in-game and youll be waiting around a lot of the time. This is just a quickly rushed license title.

title: Gauntlet: Dark Legacy
review: Its a slow and dull action game with very little technique. Top that off with NO MULTIPLAYER SUPPORT and theres really no reason to play this game. Its not fun.

title: Hour of Victory
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | First-Person | Historic | Historic | Arcade
review: Overall this is a hugely disappointing release from Midway who had seemed to be on an upward trend over the past few years. Hopefully Hour of Victory is the exception as this should have been binned long before arriving exclusively on the Xbox 360.

title: Blackwater
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | First-Person | Modern | Modern | Arcade
review: Blackwater is a definite step in the right direction to providing the motion-based FPS like the one promised when Microsoft announced their Kinect camera peripheral. But between the controversial backstory the dicey subject matter the terrible presentation and the sketchy controls it is a game that is better left on the shelf. If you want a better Kinect shooter experience check out Gunstringer.

title: NFL Blitz 20-02
review: Ostensibly a fast-paced adrenaline-style rendition of football the Game Boy Advance version of Blitz is a slow bare-bones pigskin game that bears little resemblance to its souped-up arcade inspiration.

title: Left Alive
review: Left Alive’s half-baked nature feels like a real pity because quite a few elements of the game are actually really interesting.

title: Defender
review: The graphics are simply poor. The sound is painful to the ears at time although it stuck very close to the original game.

title: Rocky and Bullwinkle
review: What at first sounds like fun for the whole family turns out to be a bad case of fun for nobody. Rocky And Bullwinkle is an unfortunate case of a good license slapped on a terrible excuse for a game.

title: Underworld Ascendant
review: Every mechanic to the game needs drastic improvements and its just plain unfortunate that Otherside Entertainment released the game as-is.

title: Wonder World Amusement Park
review: Sometimes a game is just no fun this is one of those times.

title: Ready 2 Rumble Revolution
genres: Sports | Traditional | Individual | Boxing | Boxing | Combat | Boxing / Martial Arts
review: Its awful. As it is its a disaster of a fighting game. If the boxing in Wii Sports is Amir Khan then Ready 2 Rumble Revolution is Frank Bruno.

title: Mike Tyson Heavyweight Boxing
review: An all around mess of a game Mike Tyson Heavyweight Boxing is officially one of (if not THE) worst examples of digital boxing weve ever seen.

title: Crystal Rift
review: Crystal Rift is far from an enjoyable experience with cumbersome controls lacklustre visuals and poor enemy AI. The entire experience gets very tiresome very quickly and with the ever increasing expectations for great quality games this just doesnt cut it. This rift would be better left unexplored unless you think youd enjoy its torturously repetitive depths.

title: Traitors Gate 2
review: Id have to use both my fingers and toes to tally up how many times the character suddenly materialized through a wall or walkway or big lethal spike-thingy and so on.

title: Frogger 2
review: The crummy gameplay combined with Frogger 2s deceiving graphics (kids will struggle with this game) and jab-a-screwdriver-into-your-ear music make this one of the worst titles available on XBLA.

title: Escape from Bug Island
review: Stiff controls and sloppy collision detection certainly dont help matters nor do the truly atrocious production values. [July 2007 p.94]

title: Tamagotchi Party On!
review: The mini-games are shallow and one-player only each turn drags on far too long and the sheer lack of any actual party elements keeps it from attaining even the basic – yet still redundant – entertainment found in the long-lived Mario Party series.

title: 3D Classics: Urban Champion
review: Apparently Nintendo had to revisit Urban Champion at least once. We should all be happy thats out of the way now hoping that true classics show up next in the eShop as 3D Classics.

title: Lucha Fury
review: Lucha Fury is hardly recommendable even for diehard beatem up fans.

title: Fluster Cluck
review: Fluster Cluck seemed like it might be fun and have potential as a party game but I would honestly be more embarrassed to load this up and try to convince people to play it.

title: Combat Medic: Special Operations
review: A great concept gone horribly wrong... Its too short too dull and too poorly executed. [Oct 2002 p.75]

title: Past Cure
review: I’ve read scarier issues of the Beano in this clunky buggy mess of a wanna be Deadly Premonition.

title: Dead Space Ignition
genres: Puzzle | Miscellaneous | Puzzle | Action | Puzzle | Shooter | Third-Person | Action | General | Sci-Fi
review: When your game makes you want to skip the egregiously tedious gameplay so you can see what happens in the utterly forgettable story you know youre doing something wrong.

title: Pimp My Ride
review: I honestly have to say that I had fun with this game just because the gameplay is so outrageously bad.

title: The History Channel: Battle for the Pacific
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | First-Person | Historic | Historic | Arcade
review: Battle for the Pacific is a perfect example of how you can produce a modern first person shooter with absolutely no level of innovation at all. Graphics sound and controls all do their job without impressing but the overall gameplay is utterly mediocre and not worth your time or your money.

title: Sniper: Art of Victory
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | First-Person | Tactical | Historic | Historic
review: When the essential gameplay mechanic is this flawed and theres nothing else to save it theres simply no reason to play it.

title: Torino 2006 - the Official Video Game of the XX Olympic Winter Games
review: I expected Torino 2006 to use its licence to present a confident and solid portrayal of the Olympic experience. It does neither – to be quite frank – and feels like an incredibly rushed affair.

title: Darkstar: The Interactive Movie
genres: Action | Adventure | Interactive Movie | General | Interactive Movie
review: A crime. Send this one to the colonies. [Feb 2011 p.65]

title: Shaq Fu: A Legend Reborn
review: A poorly written game with gameplay that feels stiff and archaic along with endless waves of enemies that take far too long to beat.

title: The Sum of All Fears
review: This game borders on blasphemy... What you get is a slow paced game of hide and seek where it seems no one even cares to come looking for you.

title: Kung Fu Rider
review: Kung Fu Riders bizarre and broken controls bear little correlation to whats going on in the screen and overall the game would function far more effectively if its commands were simply mapped to a DualShock controller. It would still remain utterly terrible however as the game is an uninspired mess built entirely around a core conceit that gets old surprisingly fast.

title: NBA Live 14
genres: Arcade | Sports | Traditional | Team | Basketball | Arcade
review: NBA Live 14 is one of the worst sports games I played in years. Its incredible that the game shares the same engine with FIFA 14 and Madden 25 because of its choppy gameplay poor graphics and the lack of any ideas. 2K can sleep well.

title: Coffin Dodgers
review: There are some great ideas at the core of this though and it would have been nice to see how they shaped up with a bit more direction and some extra time in the oven.

title: X-Men: Destiny
review: Its ugliness assaults your senses right from the start.

title: Fantastic Four: Rise of the Silver Surfer
review: The How-To Guide Guide on how to murder a solid license the only thing this game succeeds in is being even worse than its predecessor. [Aug 2007 p.88]

title: Damnation
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | Third-Person | Sci-Fi | Sci-Fi | Arcade
review: At best its a functional third-person platformer that sometimes acts like a shooter. At worst its an astonishing collection of poor design decisions half-hearted implementation and mindless narrative clutter that will only lead to buyers remorse in all who decide to give it a try.

title: The Shield: The Game
review: Even the most rabid of fans will be disappointed. [Sept 2007 p.80]

title: Orion: Dino Horde
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | First-Person | Sci-Fi | Arcade
review: Orion: Dino Beatdown is a disaster. Bugs glitch and the lack of contents plague the entire production. It is more an alpha version than a finished game.

title: Dream Chronicles
genres: Miscellaneous | Puzzle | Puzzle | Hidden Object | General | Puzzle | General
review: With a poor story out-dated graphics and no real depth to the puzzles and with so many great titles in the genre already available for the same price I would suggest you steer clear of this one.

title: Power Gig: Rise of the SixString
genres: Action | Miscellaneous | Rhythm | Music Maker | Music Maker | Music
review: There are songs to play you cant get anywhere else but you should really ask yourself if you to play them on a real-fake guitar.

title: Air Conflicts: Aces of World War II
review: The game isnt fun. The load times graphics presentation and lack of readable fonts and radars makes this game unplayable.

title: MTV's Celebrity Deathmatch
review: Celebrity Deathmatchs biggest problem isnt its timing but rather its the absolutely horrid gameplay and complete lack of any worthwhile features.

title: Disney Sports Skateboarding
review: Good for kids. Good for people you dont like. Not good for you.

title: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: Arcade Attack
review: Do your childhood memories a favour by not playing this.

title: Hollow
review: As far as space-set survival horror games go Hollow sets the standard for a new low.

title: Legends of Pegasus
review: Legends of Pegasus game is perfect example of how to turn ambitious projects into something you do want to forget as fast as possible. [Oct 2012]

title: Power Gig: Rise of the SixString
genres: Action | Miscellaneous | Rhythm | Music Maker | Music Maker | Music
review: With terrible graphics and an even worse story mode Power Gig is sure to leave a bad taste in your mouth!

title: Damnation
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | Third-Person | Sci-Fi | Sci-Fi | Arcade
review: The games ambition far outstrips its creators abilities: damned by execution rather than intent but damned nonetheless. [July 2009 p.99]

title: Alekhine's Gun
review: It’s not impossible to overlook Alekhine’s shopping list of shortcomings. There were a few occasions when everything would neatly come together and create something genuinely fun and entertaining. However the consistency simply isn’t there.

title: Jeremy McGrath Supercross World
review: It shall garner the first ever Eric Mattei Smelly Bowling Shoe award for achieving a new standard in caca quality.

title: Torrente
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | First-Person | Modern | Modern | Arcade
review: Torrente may just be a new Spanish word for ‘terrible’.

title: Umbrella Corps
review: Umbrella Corps is a multiplayer action with zero value. The game is flawed with all sorts of issues including dysfunctional matchmaking small number of players poor visuals and tragic AI of zombies. Hands off.

title: Risen 3: Titan Lords
review: It felt genuinely good to not be playing it anymore and that is a rare thing in games nowadays. [Oct 2014 p.92]

title: Double D Dodgeball
genres: Action | Sports | General | General | Team | Other
review: Boring in all fronts: graphics gameplay audio etc. There’s not many redeeming values packed into Double D Dodgeball so the best advice is to play the demo and call it good.

title: Arc of Alchemist
review: Arc of Alchemist feels so very dated it could easily be confused for an early Idea Factory title getting its remaster on Switch… without anything actually remastered. Unremarkable and uninspired its a quintessential mindless dungeon-crawling RPG with no real hook to set it apart. There are a million games out there that do exactly what Arc of Alchemist does but better in every way.

title: Fight Club
review: A resounding failure. Unless youre a masochistic Fight Club fan looking to purposely have your sensibilities offended then youd be well advised to stay far away from this game.

title: Eternity: The Last Unicorn
review: What a horrible game. Combat is stiff and unpleasant. The badly positioned camera constantly gets on your nerves. Where to go and what to do is totally unclear. Bosses are uninspired and no fun at all. Everything in this game screams ignore me! so thats our advice to you. Do not buy this game - you have been warned!

title: Tokyo Tattoo Girls
review: In an age where people watch other people play video games maybe its time that video games simply play themselves. Hopefully that statement sounds ridiculous to you because it is. Gamers need gameplay and Tokyo Tattoo Girls has virtually none.

title: One Piece: Grand Cruise
review: This game should have been the ultimate fan service to One Piece fans but unfortunately the game severely disappoints. The limited gameplay that the title offers is repetitive and doesnt add a whole lot. The parts where youre blasting ships and a Kraken is fun but wears thin very quickly. One Piece: Grand Cruise definitely had potential but the developer didnt take any chances at all.

title: Infernal: Hell's Vengeance
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | Third-Person | Fantasy | Fantasy | Arcade
review: The dictionary defines infernal as hellish fiendish diabolical as it should be but it also has a definition of extremely troublesome annoying. Unfortunately Infernal lives up to both of those definitions all too well.

title: Tsunami 2265
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | Third-Person | Sci-Fi | Sci-Fi | Arcade
review: Terrible. Probably the only good thing to come out of the whole experience is the games opening song. Just imagine a driving 80s generic pop anthem with cheesy power chords and lyrics about how war is love and love is war.

title: Jackass the Game
review: If Jackass the show were as bland as Jackass the game it would have been cancelled after one episode.

title: Bad Boys: Miami Takedown
review: One of the worst action games of the last 10 years.

title: Terminator 3: Rise of the Machines
review: Enemy AI is shoddy as is the hit-detection. The graphics are also deficient with nearly every element in the game looking bland. [Apr 2004 p.9]

title: Charlie and the Chocolate Factory
review: As I painfully maneuvered my Charlie from room to room I grew more and more desperate in my attempt to find redeeming qualities in the game.

title: Fantastic Four: Rise of the Silver Surfer
review: Apart from the energetic musical score theres nothing good about the Nintendo DS game. This is simply shelf fodder the game grandparents will blindly buy for Little Timmy because the parents took him to see the movie.

title: Dead Space Ignition
genres: Miscellaneous | Puzzle | Action | Shooter | Puzzle | Puzzle | Third-Person | Action | Sci-Fi
review: When both the story and the gameplay are as weak as this then youre better leaving this on the virtual shelf and picking up Dead Space Extraction instead.

title: 7 Days to Die
developer: Iron Galaxy Studios | The Fun Pimps
genres: Action | Action Adventure | Shooter | Survival | Sandbox | First-Person | Arcade
review: Its disappointing to see this sold on Xbox One and PS4 (with a retail release!) as if it is completed game. It clearly is not. After some substantial updates Id potentially want to give it another chance but as is I wouldnt want to spend another minute with it.

title: Jeremy McGrath Supercross World
review: Well we need a licence for sure...and how about some cool bands for the soundtrack?...Well I can’t think what else I would have written.Urm… I think we’re done.

title: George of the Jungle and the Search for the Secret
review: The 2.5D graphics are quite nice and it captures the character and environment well but overall we can only really recommend this to parents who want to shut their kids up for five minutes.

title: The Golden Compass
review: This game is clearly a rushed mess and perhaps should have taken a nod from the Superman Returns video game and not been released until The Golden Compass inevitable DVD release.

title: Enemy Front
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | First-Person | Tactical | Historic | Historic
review: To judge Enemy Front as a sum of its parts reveals it to be an FPS fraud - a pretender. [Sept 2014 p.104]

title: Showtime Championship Boxing
genres: Sports | Traditional | Individual | Boxing | Boxing | Combat | Boxing / Martial Arts
review: Given that Wii Sports boxing (or Punch-Out!! for that matter) is better in almost every conceivable way Showtime Championship Boxing has absolutely no business in your gaming library not even for $20. Stay far away.

title: Street Jam Basketball
review: Fails to excite in any way shape or form.

title: Bad Boys: Miami Takedown
review: Even for the budget price tag that Miami Takedown is retailing for this bomb is a horrible choice for anyone and it should absolutely be avoided.

title: NCIS
review: This is unfortunately not a good detective game nor is it a good game period.

title: Drug Wars (2009)
review: Even at its bargain price MOB is frankly appalling. [July 2009 p.73]

title: The History Channel: Battle for the Pacific
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | First-Person | Historic | Historic | Arcade
review: When a games only achievement is that its a better World War II shooter than Hour of Victory--and just barely--its time to pack it up and just go home. [Feb 2008 p.79]

title: Girl Fight
review: Dear Kung Fu Factory please try harder next time because you showed some potential but I had to look for it through a microscope. [13/2013 p.73]

title: Valhalla Knights: Eldar Saga
review: Theres really no good reason to suffer Valhalla Knights: Eldar Saga--its ugly broken and seems hellbent on depriving you of fun at every opportunity. Even if youre hard up for a Wii RPG youre better off skipping it and never looking back. Meanwhile Ill be hearing those footsteps echoing endlessly in my nightmares.

title: Super Seducer: How to Talk to Girls
review: If your goal is to never have an interaction beyond your basement this game delivers. Otherwise its only function is to give players a few laughs and severe second-hand embarrassment. Alternatively it could be turned into a drinking game with your buddies: Take a shot every time the camera goes out of focus the acronym PUA is said or there’s an opportunity to whip Big Richie out.

title: Fugitive Hunter: War on Terror
review: Other than intentionally funny games like Day of the Tentacle and Monkey Island I don’t think I’ve ever laughed more at a game than I did at Fugitive Hunter.

title: Star Raiders
genres: Action | Simulation | General | Sci-Fi | Space | Small Spaceship | Small Spaceship | Combat
review: Five hours of playing this game will kill the entire genre for you too. [Aug 2011 p.99]

title: King of Clubs
genres: Sports | Traditional | Individual | Golf | Arcade | Arcade
review: King of Clubs doesnt play a very good game of golf and the unlockable elements do little to counteract this rather glaring flaw.

title: Langrisser Re:Incarnation -TENSEI-
review: With sluggish gameplay off-putting presentation and bafflingly poor design decisions at every turn Langrisser Re:Incarnation Tensei is an entirely underwhelming revival of a once-beloved series and a subpar SRPG besides.

title: ShellShock 2: Blood Trails
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | First-Person | Third-Person | Historic | Historic | Historic | Arcade
review: Shellshock 2 will shock you but for all the wrong reasons. Even if youre a fan of the genre its a technically inept and totally unenjoyable experience.

title: Fireburst
genres: Driving | Racing | Simulation | Rally / Offroad | Rally / Offroad | Automobile
review: To put it bluntly don’t bother with Fireburst.

title: Rambo: The Video Game
review: Rambo: The Video Game is an awkward short ugly and expensive game that tries to generate some nostalgia but ultimately fails. Instead of spending money on Teyons creation its better to watch the entire game on YouTube or better yet - watch all the movies. And the best thing to do is: go for a walk find a video arcade and beat Virtua Cop one more time.

title: Jekyll & Hyde (2001)
review: Poor graphics horrible animation and the lack of any challenge far outweigh whatever story this game might have.

title: The Expendables 2 Videogame
genres: Action | General | Shooter | Third-Person | Shoot-'Em-Up | Modern | Top-Down
review: As a fan of competent twin stick shooters I found nothing at all in The Expendables 2 that would warrant me to recommend this game in any way. Boring gameplay drab levels and poorly produced content are the headliners here; avoid at all costs even if you are a fan of the movies. There are better games in this vein to spend your money on and one of them Tomb Raider: Guardian of Light is even free at the moment if you have a Playstation Plus subscription.

title: David Beckham Soccer
review: The controls and gameplay are as poorly designed as the graphics and audio.

title: Shadow Harvest: Phantom Ops
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | Third-Person | Tactical | Modern | Modern
review: Its not even remotely close to being fun and serves as a fine example of how not to make an action game. [Sept 2011 p.77]

title: Takedown: Red Sabre
genres: Action | Shooter | General | Shooter | First-Person | Modern | Tactical
review: Please dont get fooled by Serellans proclamations and dont fall in the trap. Takedown: Red Sabre is a terrible first person shooter ugly to watch and painful to play. You wont get any fun from it even if you insist on fighting against its flaws. Stay away from it.

title: Destroy All Humans! Path of the Furon
review: Avoid this one unless you’re a sucker for dickhead aliens. The Path of the Furon leads straight to disappointment.

title: The Walking Dead: Survival Instinct
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | First-Person | Sci-Fi | Sci-Fi | Arcade
review: This game tries to ride with the same horse as Telltale. Although the names are identical the games themselves are just the opposite of one another. This is utter garbage in every single meter. Steer away. [May 2013]

title: Past Cure
review: Its a genuinely bad game in every respect. [May 2018 p.82]

title: March of the Penguins
review: The selling point of this game seems to be some sort of edutainment. Yet besides a few scant factoids in between levels the game boasts nothing worth teaching.

title: Agony
review: Laborious and horribly put together Agony really will put you through hell. [Aug 2018 p.78]

title: Transformers: Dark of the Moon - Stealth Force Edition
review: To quote Galvatron This is bad comedy. [Aug 2011 p.90]

title: You Are Empty
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | First-Person | Historic | Arcade
review: Why am I empty then? Perhaps because this crass banal unchallenging belch of a first person shooter has left me that way groaning and giggling like a mental patient. [Nov 2007 p.72]

title: Astro Boy: The Video Game
review: Do yourself a favor and hunt down the GBA game if you have an Astro Boy craving. Just ignore this pile which is 100 percent pure uncut shovelware.

title: Bomberman: Act Zero
genres: Miscellaneous | Puzzle | Action | General | Puzzle | Action
review: The game play was weak the graphics weak and the audio even worse. I was fed up and bored with this game after just a mere six minutes of playtime.

title: Fantasy Hero: Unsigned Legacy
review: It’s rare that I can’t find positives to talk about in detail and it’s a real shame that Fantasy Hero ~Unsigned Legacy~ game wasn’t improved in any way but simply ported with no tangible improvements over the PS Vita original. Fantasy Hero has the occasional solid mechanic in place but neither the story nor its gameplay boast any interest or originality. This game may have been considered pretty average upon its original release in 2014 but by modern standards it’s incredibly poor.

title: The Shield: The Game
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | Third-Person | Modern | Modern | Arcade
review: Just buy it on DVD and leave it at that. [Apr 2007 p.71]

title: Girl Fight
review: There are loads of great fighting games out on the market right now. Girl Fight is not one of them and if you desperately need to watch girls fight there are probably better options for that as well.

title: McFarlane's Evil Prophecy
review: The completely screwed-up camera noticeable lack of sound effects and gameplay bugs make it obvious no one working on this game cared about it - why should you? [Sept 2004 p.104]

title: Chicago Enforcer
review: It truly manages to re-create what it must be like to be on the wrong end of a mob shakedown because by the end of the experience youll pretty much feel like youve had your head caved in with a lead pipe.

title: Shrek: Super Party
review: Lets just say that the only way to ruin a party quicker than loading up Shrek Super Party is to load up Nickelodeon Party Blast. Stay away!

title: AMY
review: As a downloadable title I wasnt expecting Amy to measure up against the triple-A juggernauts of the survival horror genre. However I was expecting a game that was at least playable and contained some kind of entertainment. Make no mistake: Whether Amy is delivered to you via download retail SKU direct brain wave or retinal implant it is terrible and should be avoided.

title: Kick-Ass
review: Compared to the quality of other PSN titles Kick-Ass does nothing to stand out. An array of unforgivable technical issues mar what is already a needlessly boring and repetitious beatem-up.

title: Superman Returns
genres: Action | Action Adventure | Beat-'Em-Up | Beat-'Em-Up | Open-World | 2D
review: The game is short damn short. It can be finished in about an hour or so and once you have sussed out the way the simple strategy part works all further enjoyment can only be derived from the main missions which Im sure youll realise by now cant save this Superman.

title: The Incredible Hulk
review: Its huge. Its green. Its bad. And its lame. The comic and the movie rock but on a PC Hulk receives a thrashing from any budget arcade game. [Aug 2008]

title: Mike Tyson Heavyweight Boxing
review: The big draw aside from the fun cheating Mike Tyson parts is the damage textures applied to the face and the little blood spurts and sweat coming off your boxers face after he takes a punch...Once you take so many hits your boxer will go from bruised to cut to Face Critical! Whoopty-doo. One feature doesnt make your entire game Codemasters.

title: Farming Simulator
review: Thank God our daily bread and cereal is not dependent on this game.

title: X Rebirth
genres: Simulation | Sci-Fi | Space | Large Spaceship | Large Spaceship | Civilian
review: Long story short: In its current state X Rebirth is just a sad affair.

title: Dawn of Fear
review: Dawn of Fear is a poor attempt to recreate the magic of a survival horror classic with too many problems to gain any sense of enjoyment. Brok3nsite has tried to create a nostalgic tribute to Resident Evil but in the process they’ve somehow made it worse than the original. Perhaps its biggest omission and ultimate failure is its scare factor creating predictable moments of terror that never hit as they should.

title: Van Helsing
review: An absolute crapfest of a portable experience.

title: Yu Yu Hakusho: Spirit Detective
review: Both the fighting and exploration are poorly executed and the visuals look like they leapt right out of a medium-quality NES title. [Jan 2004 p.76]

title: Demonworld: Dark Armies
review: Dark Armies wretchedly tells you exactly what you need to do (i.e. move your units down by those trees and change their formation) but never gives even the slightest hint in the direction of the almighty how the hell that is done (i.e. what combination of keys and mouse buttons you must manipulate to get an action done).

title: Dragon Booster
review: A poor game with next to no modes excitement or stuff to recommend it. [July 2006 p.84]

title: Call of Duty: Black Ops Declassified
genres: Shooter | Modern | Action | Shooter | First-Person | Modern | Arcade
review: A frustrating game uninspired and just smears the name of the series that sells the most in the industry today.

title: Mistmare
review: Mistmare has more bugs than an apartment in the Projects. The game is virtually unplayable. Its more horrendous than the Inquisition - and just about as much fun. I dont even know where to begin to lament on the inadequacies of this… abomination.

title: Mortal Kombat Advance
review: A game that shatters expectations but in the worst conceivable manner. What we have here is a game so awful that it truly is in a class all by itself. Its just mind boggling how bad this game is.

title: Mobile Suit Gundam: Crossfire
genres: Simulation | Sci-Fi | Vehicle | Mech | Mech | Combat
review: In the end it proves too bland and generic for mech enthusiasts and just a poor game for the uninitiated.

title: Megamind: Ultimate Showdown
review: Overall Megamind: Ultimate Showdown is a fairly poor game. The lack of anything innovative makes it just like the other movie-based games currently on the market. This is only one to purchase if youre an achievement junkie and even they might think twice.

title: Target: Terror
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | Light Gun | Light Gun
review: Youll have more fun laughing at this light-gun shooter than playing it.

title: Iron Man
review: He can fly! And thatd be about it - Iron Man cant jump climb the ladder or pick any Goddamned thing. When the novelty of flying wears off all that remains is a very disappointing shooter lacking any challenge. Oh and I saw much prettier games on PlayStation 2. [July 2008]

title: Bruce Lee: Quest of the Dragon
review: Exceptionally poor: we imagine Bruce is rolling in his grave right now. [Oct 2002 p.109]

title: Rekoil
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | First-Person | Modern | Modern | Arcade
review: Rekoil is a banal title with poorly implemented features confusing UI and ugly aesthetics. I can appreciate what Plastic Piranha tried to do but sadly they have failed to deliver on promises of balanced competitive gameplay – and even on some of the basic core mechanics of a competent FPS.

title: Zombeer
review: Zombeer is bad. The humor is scattershot and groan-inducing while the gameplay is barely functional.

title: Women's Volleyball Championship
review: I can understand trying to do a budget version of volleyball but when 8-bit versions of the sport actually offer more fun (and maybe even look better) theres quite literally zero reason to take a look at the game.

title: MTV's Celebrity Deathmatch
review: Its neither run nor funny - youre better off spending $20 on something else. [Jan 2004 p.125]

title: Weeping Doll
review: Going into Weeping Doll I was hoping to experience a horror game in the glory that is VR. Sadly Weeping Doll didn’t deliver much of anything except a simple puzzle solving game that feels undercooked.

title: Land of the Dead: Road to Fiddler's Green
review: A mess of a game. Its not even a game more like a slow rotting death. No matter how great your love for George Romero no matter how overpowering your curiosity there is no reason to look twice at Land of the Dead. Do not walk away. Run.

title: Escape Dead Island
genres: Action Adventure | Adventure | 3D | Survival | Third-Person | Modern
review: You really shouldn’t play Escape Dead Island. It isn’t fun and the only real redeeming feature is that it is technically playable.

title: Sonic Boom: Rise of Lyric
review: Possibly the worst blotch on Sonics record. [Feb 2015 p.73]

title: Gene Rain
review: That this cover shooter took a lot of inspiration from Gears of War isn’t a bad thing. At least if you compared it to the poor visuals the thin sound and the abysmal English localization that takes it far beyond trash.

title: Giana Sisters: Dream Runners
review: Its dated looks slippery controls and occasional bugs don’t exactly help but the lack of originality compared to both Giana Sisters: Twisted Dreams and Speedrunners just highlight the problems with this copy and paste effort. Go play Giana Sisters: Twisted Dreams instead of this.

title: Best of Tests DS
review: There’s very little here to challenge a first grader and the memory games are just way too insulting. Brain Age still the intelligent choice so avoid this one at all costs.

title: The Walking Dead: Survival Instinct
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | First-Person | Sci-Fi | Sci-Fi | Arcade
review: An interesting concept thats been realised into a totally horrible and dull shooter/stealth action crossover that I cannot recommend to fans of the series not even to fans of the Walking Dead comics. The only noticeable positive about it is its voice acting.

title: New World Order
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | First-Person | Modern | Tactical | Modern | Arcade
review: The single-player mode is a painful and sometimes laughable experience. Multiplayer fares much better provided you can find people to play with online but there are much better titles out there to choose from.

title: The Expendables 2 Videogame
genres: Action | General | Shooter | Third-Person | Shoot-'Em-Up | Modern | Top-Down
review: This is worthless rote action done much better elsewhere. [Nov 2012 p.78]

title: Jenga World Tour
review: This game gets a low score because there is no point to it.

title: Fighters Uncaged
review: Controls rather your body is wonky.

title: Dave Mirra BMX Challenge
review: The problem is that it plays like Tony Hawks 1999 debut. Worse yet its not even on par with that.

title: Coliseum
review: This game got repetitious after about 15 minutes and downright treadmill-like within a half-hour. The emperors verdict: Thumb down. [May 2004 p.71]

title: Kabuki Warriors
review: Mind-boggling travesty. [Jan 2002 p.231]

title: Pool Party
genres: Sports | Miscellaneous | Parlor | Individual | Billiards | Billiards
review: Everything you can think of is wrongfully done in this game.

title: Magus
review: Like Birdemic or The Room Magus is so terrible that it can only be called a masterpiece.

title: Ghostbusters
review: I don’t particularly like pointing out so many negatives but when there’s virtually no positives to speak about it’s difficult not to. A nonexistent storyline basic and repetitive gameplay terrible and constant one-liners and nothing that makes it feel like a real Ghostbusters experience makes this game a difficult sell at $20 but it’s price is unfathomably three times that amount.

title: The Simpsons Wrestling
review: I’m not sure why this game was ever made.

title: Tony Hawk's Pro Skater 5
review: Robomodos Activision-mandated update most often challenges players strangely not to score big but stupidly.

title: Toy Shop
genres: Strategy | Tycoon | Management | Tycoon | Business / Tycoon
review: Not worth the time of you or your child.

title: The Asskickers
review: Does little to elevate itself over the antiquated genre it spawned from. The hand-drawn 2D art is nice and the real-world caricatures that act as bosses after each stage might elicit a smirk but the game is short shallow and unable to properly execute the simple tried-and-true beat em up gameplay style let alone advance it.
